thread.title: Loss to Mexico punctuates a rough year for US soccer
thread.title_full: Loss to Mexico punctuates a rough year for US soccer

author: GREG BEACHAM
title: Loss to Mexico punctuates a rough year for US soccer
text:
Jae C. Hong Loss to Mexico punctuates a rough year for US soccer 
United States's Bobby Woods, center, leaves the pitch after the CONCACAF Cup soccer match at the Rose Bowl Stadium, in Pasadena , Calif. Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, The US team lost 2-3 to Mexico. (AP Photo/Jae C. Hong) Jae C. Hong Paul Aguilar's extra-time goal puts Mexico past US 3-2 
United States coach Jurgen Klinsmann acknowledges the fans after his team lost 2-3 to Mexico during the CONCACAF Cup playoff soccer match at the Rose Bowl Stadium, in Pasadena , Calif. Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, (AP Photo/Jae C. Hong) Jae C. Hong Loss to Mexico punctuates a rough year for US soccer 
United States’ Clint Dempsey leaves the field followed by teammate Bobby Wood after losing 2-3 against Mexico in the CONCACAF Cup soccer match at the Rose Bowl Stadium, in Pasadena , Calif. Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, Mexico qualified for the 2017 Confederations Cup in Russia. (AP Photo/Jae C. Hong) Jae C. Hong Loss to Mexico punctuates a rough year for US soccer 
United States’ Bobby Wood celebrates scoring his side's 2nd goal against Mexico during the CONCACAF Confederations Cup playoff soccer match at the Rose Bowl Stadium, in Pasadena , Calif. Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, (AP Photo/Jae C. Hong) Jae C. Hong Loss to Mexico punctuates a rough year for US soccer 
United States’ DeAndre Yedlin, left, and Mexico’s Arturo Rivas go for a header during the CONCACAF Cup soccer match at the Rose Bowl Stadium, in Pasadena , Calif. Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, (AP Photo/Jae C. Hong) Jae C. Hong Loss to Mexico punctuates a rough year for US soccer 
United States’ Jozy Altidore, left, and Clint Dempsey gesture next to Mexico’s Hector Herrera, center, during the CONCACAF Confederations Cup playoff soccer match at the Rose Bowl Stadium, in Pasadena , Calif. Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, (AP Photo/Jae C. Hong) Posted: Sunday, October 11, 2015 4:29 pm | Updated: 5:00 pm, Sun Oct 11, 2015. Loss to Mexico punctuates a rough year for US soccer Associated Press | 
PASADENA, Calif. (AP) — The American Outlaws and their fellow U.S. soccer fans were louder, rowdier and more numerous than they were four years ago for their team's last clash with Mexico at the Rose Bowl. 
They were still wildly outnumbered and heavily out-roared by the Mexican fans who turned the U.S. national team into visitors in its own stadium Saturday night.
